edu.princeton.cs.algs4

Class GlobalMincut

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.princeton.cs.algs4.GlobalMincut

  • public class GlobalMincut
extends java.lang.Object
    The GlobalMincut class represents a data type for computing a global minimum cut in an edge-weighted graph where the edge weights are nonnegative. A cut is a partition of the set of vertices of a graph into two nonempty subsets. An edge that has one endpoint in each subset of a cut is a crossing edge. The weight of a cut is the sum of the weights of its crossing edges. A global minimum cut is a cut for which the weight is not larger than the weight of any other cut.

    The weight() method returns the weight of the minimum cut and the cut(int v) method determines if a vertex v is on the first or on the second subset of vertices of the minimum cut.

    This is an implementation of Stoerâ€“Wagner's algorithm using an index priority queue and the union-find data type in order to simplify dealing with contracting edges. Precisely, the index priority queue is an instance of IndexMaxPQ which is based on a binary heap. As a consequence, the constructor takes O(V (V + E ) log V ) time and O(V) extra space (not including the graph), where V is the number of vertices and E is the number of edges. However, this time can be reduced to O(V E + V2 log V) by using an index priority queue implemented using Fibonacci heaps.

    Afterwards, the weight() and cut(int v) methods take constant time.

    For additional documentation, see

    • M. Stoer and F. Wagner (1997). A simple min-cut algorithm. Journal of the ACM , 44(4):585-591.

      • cut

        public boolean cut(int v)
        Returns true if the vertex v is on the first subset of vertices of the minimum cut; or false if the vertex v is on the second subset.
        Returns:
        true if the vertex v is on the first subset of vertices of the minimum cut; or false if the vertex v is on the second subset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - unless vertex v is between 0 and (G.V() - 1)

      • makeCut

        private void makeCut(int t,
                     UF uf)
        Makes a cut for the current edge-weighted graph by partitioning its set of vertices into two nonempty subsets. The vertices connected to the vertex t belong to the first subset. Other vertices not connected to t belong to the second subset.
        Parameters:
        t - the vertex t
        uf - the union-find data type

      • minCut

        private void minCut(EdgeWeightedGraph G,
                    int a)
        Computes a minimum cut of the edge-weighted graph. Precisely, it computes the lightest of the cuts-of-the-phase which yields the desired minimum cut.
        Parameters:
        G - the edge-weighted graph
        a - the starting vertex

      • minCutPhase

        private GlobalMincut.CutPhase minCutPhase(EdgeWeightedGraph G,
                                          boolean[] marked,
                                          GlobalMincut.CutPhase cp)
        Returns the cut-of-the-phase. The cut-of-the-phase is a minimum s-t-cut in the current graph, where s and t are the two vertices added last in the phase. This algorithm is known in the literature as maximum adjacency search or maximum cardinality search.
        Parameters:
        G - the edge-weighted graph
        marked - the array of contracted vertices, where marked[v] is true if the vertex v was already contracted; or false otherwise
        cp - the previous cut-of-the-phase
        Returns:
        the cut-of-the-phase

        Throws:
